data:
This 'GPS' (Getting the Proper Skills) project sees a group of 14 young people from Finland and 14 from Northern Ireland come together to 'navigate' their ways through the minefield of developing skills for the workplace and/or Further/Higher education. 

The group will take time to visit various educational and employment institutions in both Northern Ireland and Finland and determine which skills would be necessary to work or attend them. 

Once the skills have been identified the group will take time to detail them and disseminate them amongst their peers in the form of skills fact-sheets in an effort to maximize the numbers of young people taking up opportunities for employment or learning.

The group will also have time to get to know each other, learn about each others culture, tradition and country and socialise together and learn through a relaxed, informal learning programme.
